sparkmate.title: Full-time job
sparkmate.subtitle: Software Engineer
sparkmate.description:
From ideas and conception to prototyping and pre production, we support the customer and develop technological solutions 

•Project analysis: understanding of project vision, writting of class diagrams, use cases, state diagrams, etc.
•Project management: acceptance testing, planning, monitoring, etc.
•Application design modeling (UI wise and architecture wise) 
•Development of applications (frontend and backend)
•CI/CD using GitLab, docker and AWS/GCP

ds.title: 6 months internship
ds.subtitle: FullStack Engineer
ds.description:
Development of widget prototypes (new features, evolutions, fixes)
• Process improvements: source code management, automated tests, build, continuous rollout.
• Use of the latest technologies and frameworks, front-end (React, Vue, d3), back-end (AWS, NestJs)
• Development, testing and release workflow (integration / continuous delivery / deployment) : Git, GitLab, webpack, TDD, Linting...

af.title: 6 months internship
af.subtitle: FullStack Engineer
af.description:
Improvement of existing Angular/Electron based applications
• Redesigning the GUIs of some applications to match the needs of the pilots
• Improving backend performance by code and complexity analysis and rework on Websocket
• Implementation of a Service Worker on an app to make it a Progressive Web App

rhythm-game.title: 🛠️ : A rust rhythm game
rhythm-game.description:
Game made in Rust using the Bevy game engine to improve myself in the language and discover advanced concepts. In its final version, the project will include a backend for multiplayer, CI and unit tests.
The game also includes a web version exported in Web Assembly

categories.skillsUsed: Rust, Bevy, Docker, Github Actions, GCP

safeTrip.title: Safe Trip : An android application to prevent harassing
safeTrip.description:
SafeTrip is a mobile application (Android) written in Kotlin which aims to
                    prevent aggressions using machine learning (Weka algorithms). The smartphone
                    detects 4 cases: a fall, a run, a suspicious location or the entry in a vehicle
                    using ML. In case of problem, the application takes control of the phone by
                    launching a loud alarm and then after ten seconds, alerts the relatives by
                    sending an SMS containing the position of the victim and notifies the users of
                    the application within a radius of a few kilometers using Firebase API

categories.primaryRole: Elaboration of the specifications and development of the application
categories.skillsUsed: Kotlin, Machine Learning with Weka, Firebase API
categories.lessonsLearned: Market research, search for innovation, advanced  mobile development, machine learning basics

footballMatch.title: Football Match
footballMatch.description:
Football Match is a web application project designed to connect players and coaches of amateur clubs who would like to organize matches between them more easily.

Developed in React, the application allows you to find on a map all the matches available in your area and offers the possibility to participate or to create new ones

categories.primaryRole: Development of the application and research of innovative features
categories.lessonsLearned: Start a project from 0, including specifications. Adapt to a group of people with different skills. Improve React and Nest.js competencies, hooks, etc.

inaudibleSounds.title: Communication by inaudible sounds
inaudibleSounds.description: In order to train my electronic skills, I built a system using Arduino and Android to send information with inaudible sounds. A speaker is used to send out inaudible ultrasound which is interpreted by the telephone using Fourier transformations

categories.lessonsLearned: Carry out a project based on arduino, use mathematics in computing, think of a way to interpret an inaudible signal

footer.builtFromScratch: Built from scratch with React, Typescript, Next.js, PWA, Three.js, ChakraUI, Turborepo, etc.
